intro: Adenocarpus anisochilus, commonly known as the variable leaf burr legume, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, with a distinctive papilionaceous structure. The species is known for its variability in leaf shape and size, which contributes to its common name.
